at0000.1.description: Generic container for information provided by an individual.
Generisk container for informasjon gitt av et individ.
*Generic container for information provided by an individual. (en)
Generell behållare för information som tillhandahålls av en individ.
Generischer Container für Informationen, die von einer Person bereitgestellt werden.
Conteneur générique pour des informations fournies par un individu.
Contentor genérico para informação fornecida por um indivíduo.

de.purpose: Bewertung der selbstberichteten Müdigkeit und ihrer Auswirkungen auf die täglichen Aktivitäten und Funktionen bei Patienten ab 18 Jahren.
keywords: FACIT-Fatigue, FACIT, fatigue, PROM, proms, patient reported outcomes, Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy – Fatigue Scale
de.use:
Lizenzierung und Urheberrecht: 
Während die openEHR-Archetypen alle unter einer offenen Lizenz frei verfügbar sind, ist der spezifische Inhalt dieses Archetyps urheberrechtlich geschützt. Jegliche Verwendung dieses Archetyps innerhalb von Implementierungen muss in Übereinstimmung mit den von den Urheberrechtsinhabern festgelegten Bedingungen erfolgen.

Von FACIT: Für die kommerzielle Nutzung werden Lizenzgebühren pro Testversion/pro Maßnahme erhoben. Für die Nutzung der englischen Version wird keine Gebühr erhoben, es sollte jedoch eine Lizenz erworben werden. Die nichtkommerzielle Nutzung wird von Fall zu Fall beurteilt. Lizenzgebühren werden in der Regel nicht für von Forschern initiierte Forschung, Studenten oder klinische Nutzung erhoben. Um eine verfügbare Version dieser Maßnahme für kommerzielle oder nicht-kommerzielle Zwecke zu lizenzieren, füllen Sie bitte das Formular auf der FACIT-Website (https://www.facit.org/license-registration-form) aus, BEVOR Sie diesen openEHR-Archetyp in Ihrem System verwenden.

en.purpose: To assesses self-reported fatigue and its impact upon daily activities and function in patients 18 years and older.
keywords: FACIT-Fatigue, FACIT, fatigue, PROM, proms, patient reported outcomes, Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy – Fatigue Scale
en.use:
Licensing and copyright: 
While openEHR archetypes are all freely available under an open license, the specific content of this archetype is copyright protected. Any use of this archetype within implementations must be in compliance with the terms established by the copyright owners.

From FACIT: Licensing fees are assessed on a per trial/per measure basis for commercial use. There is no fee for use of the English version, but a license should be obtained. Non-commercial use is assessed on a case-by-case basis. Licensing fees are typically not applied to investigator-initiated research, students, or clinical use. To license an available version of this measure for commercial or non-commercial use, please complete the form at FACIT website (https://www.facit.org/license-registration-form) BEFORE using this openEHR archetype in your system.

fr.purpose: Évaluer la fatigue déclarée et son impact sur les activités et fonctions quotidiennes chez les patients âgés de 18 ans et plus.
keywords: FACIT-Fatigue, FACIT, fatigue, PROM, proms, patient reported outcomes, Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy – Fatigue Scale
fr.use:
Licence et droits d'auteur : 
Bien que les archétypes de l'OpenEHR soient tous disponibles gratuitement sous une licence ouverte, le contenu spécifique de cet archétype est protégé par des droits d'auteur. Toute utilisation de cet archétype dans les implémentations doit être conforme aux conditions établies par les détenteurs des droits d'auteur.

De FACIT : Les frais de licence sont évalués par essai/par mesure pour l'utilisation commerciale. Il n'y a pas de frais pour l'utilisation de la version anglaise, mais une licence doit être obtenue. L'utilisation non commerciale est évaluée au cas par cas. Les frais de licence ne s'appliquent généralement pas aux recherches menées à l'initiative des chercheurs, aux étudiants ou à l'utilisation clinique. Pour obtenir une licence pour une version disponible de cette mesure à des fins commerciales ou non commerciales, veuillez remplir le formulaire sur le site web de FACIT (https://www.facit.org/license-registration-form) AVANT d'utiliser cet archétype openEHR dans votre système.

otherDetails.licence: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

at0000.1.description: Series of questions and associated answers used to screen for the harmful or hazardous use of medications, and other legal and illegal substances.
at0000.1.comment: Also known as substance abuse, and includes substance dependence, addiction and doping. Examples of substances include, but are not limited to, alcohol, tobacco, amphetamines, barbiturates, benzodiazepines, cannabis, cocaine, hallucinogens, opioids, anabolic steroids, erythropoietin, or sniffing glue.

at0027.1.text: In your lifetime, have you ever regularly drunk caffeinated drink, that is, at least once per week for 6 months or longer?
at0027.1.description: Is there a history of use of any substance related to the screening purpose?
at0027.1.comment: In a template, the data element would usually be renamed to the specific question asked. The proposed value set can be adapted for local use by using the DV_TEXT or the DV_BOOLEAN datatypes choice to match each specific use case.

at0024.1.description: Is there a history of use of a specific substance or group of substances.
at0024.1.comment: In a template, the data element would usually be renamed to the specific question asked. The proposed value set can be adapted for local use by using the DV_TEXT or the DV_BOOLEAN datatypes choice to match each specific use case. For example an alternative valueset using the DV_TEXT datatype can be: Currently using [The individual currently uses the specific substance either on a regular basis or as required.] Never used [The individual has never used the specific substance.] Used in the past [The individual has used the specific substance in the past, but isn't currently using it.] Unknown [It is not known whether the individual uses or has used the specific substance.]

at0026.1.description: Details about a specified substance or grouping of substances relevant for the screening purpose.
at0026.1.comment: Use separate instances of this CLUSTER to differentiate between specific substances or groupings of substance.
